component.name: azure-storage-datalake
component.title: Azure Storage Datalake Service
component.description: Sends and receives files to/from Azure DataLake Storage.
component.label: cloud,file,bigdata

close.description: Whether or not a file changed event raised indicates completion (true) or modification (false)

closeStreamAfterRead.description: check for closing stream after read

credentialType.label: common
credentialType.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt

dataCount.description: count number of bytes to download

directoryName.description: directory of the file to be handled in component

fileDir.description: directory of file to do operations in the local system

fileName.description: name of file to be handled in component

fileOffset.description: offset position in file for different operations

maxResults.description: maximum number of results to show at a time

maxRetryRequests.description: no of retries to a given request

openOptions.description: set open options for creating file

path.description: path in azure datalake for operations

position.description: This parameter allows the caller to upload data in parallel and control the order in which it is appended to the file.

regex.description: regular expression for matching file names

retainUncommitedData.description: Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation

serviceClient.description: datalake service client for azure storage datalake

sharedKeyCredential.description: shared key credential for azure datalake gen2

userPrincipalNameReturned.description: whether or not to use upn

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

healthCheckConsumerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckConsumerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

healthCheckProducerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckProducerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeListFileSystems.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeListFileSystems.description: Defines options available to configure the behavior of a call to listFileSystemsSegment on a DataLakeServiceAsyncClient object. Null may be passed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeTimeout.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeTimeout.description: An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOperation.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOperation.description: Specify the producer operation to execute. Different operations allowed are shown below.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileSystemName.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileSystemName.description: Name of the file system in azure datalake on which operation is to be performed. Please make sure that filesystem name is all lowercase.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDirectoryName.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDirectoryName.description: Name of the directory in azure datalake on which operation is to be performed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileName.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileName.description: Name of the file in azure datalake on which operation is to be performed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeMetadata.label: from both
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeMetadata.description: The metadata to associate with the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePublicAccessTyp.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePublicAccessTyp.description: Defines options available to configure the behavior of a call to listFileSystemsSegment on a DataLakeServiceAsyncClient object.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRawHttpHeaders.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRawHttpHeaders.description: Non parsed http headers that can be used by the user.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRequestConditio.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRequestConditio.description: This contains values which will restrict the successful operation of a variety of requests to the conditions present. These conditions are entirely optional.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeListPathOptions.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeListPathOptions.description: Defines options available to configure the behavior of a call to listContainersSegment on a DataLakeFileSystemClient object. Null may be passed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePath.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePath.description: Path of the file to be used for upload operations.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRecursive.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRecursive.description: Specifies if the call to listContainersSegment should recursively include all paths.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeMaxResults.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeMaxResults.description: Specifies the maximum number of blobs to return, including all BlobPrefix elements.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeUserPrincipalNa.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeUserPrincipalNa.description: Specifies if the name of the user principal should be returned.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRegex.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRegex.description: Filter the results to return only those files with match the specified regular expression.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileDir.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileDir.description: Directory in which the file is to be downloaded.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentMD5.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentMD5.description: An MD5 hash of the content. The hash is used to verify the integrity of the file during transport.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileRange.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileRange.description: This is a representation of a range of bytes on a file, typically used during a download operation. Passing null as a FileRange value will default to the entire range of the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeParallelTransfe.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeParallelTransfe.description: The configuration used to parallelize data transfer operations.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOpenOptions.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOpenOptions.description: Set of OpenOption used to configure how to open or create a file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeAccessTierChang.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeAccessTierChang.description: Datetime when the access tier of the blob last changed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCacheControl.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCacheControl.description: Cache control specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentDisposit.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentDisposit.description: Content disposition specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentEncoding.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentEncoding.description: Content encoding specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentLanguage.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentLanguage.description: Content language specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentType.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentType.description: Content type specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyCompletionT.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyCompletionT.description: Conclusion time of the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this file was the destination file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyId.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyId.description: String identifier for this copy operation.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyProgress.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyProgress.description: Contains the number of bytes copied and the total bytes in the source in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this file was the destination file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopySource.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopySource.description: URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies the source file or file used in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this file was the destination file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyStatus.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyStatus.description: Status of the last copy operation performed on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyStatusDescr.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyStatusDescr.description: The description of the copy's status

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeEncryptionKeySh.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeEncryptionKeySh.description: The SHA-256 hash of the encryption key used to encrypt the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeETag.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeETag.description: The E Tag of the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLastModified.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLastModified.description: Datetime when the file was last modified.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseDuration.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseDuration.description: Type of lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseState.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseState.description: State of the lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseStatus.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseStatus.description: Status of the lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeIncrementalCopy.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeIncrementalCopy.description: Flag indicating if the file was incrementally copied.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeServerEncrypted.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeServerEncrypted.description: Flag indicating if the file's content is encrypted on the server.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLinkExp.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLinkExp.description: Set the Expiration time of the download link.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLink.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLink.description: The link that can be used to download the file from datalake.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileOffset.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileOffset.description: The position where the data is to be appended.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseId.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseId.description: By setting lease id, requests will fail if the provided lease does not match the active lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePathHttpHeaders.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePathHttpHeaders.description: Additional parameters for a set of operations.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRetainCommitedD.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRetainCommitedD.description: Determines Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeClose.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeClose.description: Whether or not a file changed event raised indicates completion (true) or modification (false).

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePosition.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePosition.description: The length of the file after all data has been written.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeExpression.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeExpression.description: The query expression on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeInputSerializat.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeInputSerializat.description: Defines the input serialization for a file query request. either FileQueryJsonSerialization or FileQueryDelimitedSerialization

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOutputSerializa.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOutputSerializa.description: Defines the output serialization for a file query request. either FileQueryJsonSerialization or FileQueryDelimitedSerialization

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeErrorConsumer.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeErrorConsumer.description: Sets error consumer for file query

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeProgressConsume.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeProgressConsume.description: Sets progress consumer for file query

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileClient.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileClient.description: Sets the file client to use

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFlush.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFlush.description: Sets whether to flush on append

regex.description: regular expression for matching file names

retainUncommitedData.description: Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation

serviceClient.description: datalake service client for azure storage datalake

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
